intro: Pedicularis lasiophrys var. sinica, commonly known as the Chinese flame vetch, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers that resemble those of the foxglove. The plant is hemiparasitic, meaning it partially relies on host plants for water and nutrients. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its unique floral structure and coloration make it a notable species in botanical studies and horticulture.
